intro: Galium noli-tangere, commonly known as touch-me-not or false nettle, is a herbaceous perennial plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is characterized by its opposite, simple leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers clustered in umbels, which are typically followed by red, berry-like fruits. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in woodlands and along stream banks. Galium noli-tangere is known for its stinging hairs, which can cause skin irritation upon contact.
